alert.note: Alert for Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 10:17PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington Parish, Walthall and southeastern Pike Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1016 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Magnolia, or 13 miles southeast of Mccomb, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tylertown, Dexter and Angie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Louisiana.
